newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek June private construction up 8.4 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Greek June private construction up 8.4 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Greece's index of private construction activity, measured by the number of building permits, was up 8.4 percent year-on-year in June, the National Statistics Service (NSS) said in a statement.
"In June, construction volume based on the number of building permits nationwide reached 4.89 million cubic metres against 4.51 million in June 1995, a rise of 8.4 percent," NSS said.
June construction activity in the Attica region was up 3.3 percent year-on-year, reaching 1.33 million cubic metres.
Construction activity had jumped 15.7 percent in May.
In the first half of the year, private construction activity was up by 20.1 percent, with the rise more pronounced in the Attica region, which gained 32.0 percent.
